page.title: 03LAMMAS, with LT. HAUTBOIS
page.content: In local government terms Lammas and Buxton are no different as both have the same{Parish Council.}However geographically and ecclesiasitically they are different. The River Bure alone separates the two parishes. Lammas is much smaller having only about 200 inhabitants. The buildings in Lammas are older than those in Buxton. It has only one street which in true Norfolk fashion is called{The Street.}There is an old {Manor House}parts of which are Elizabethan. The present{Hall,}now an Old People's Home, is Jacobean in style and certainly dates from that period. There is only one shop which also serves as a{Post Office.} The authoress{Anna Sewell}of 'Black Beauty' fame is buried in the Old Quaker Burial Ground.
